heroSection.title: ADE Community Based Organization
heroSection.subtitle: changing lives one goal at a time

aboutSection.title: Who We Are
aboutSection.intro: ADE Community Based Organization (ADE CBO) is a registered, community-led non-profit in Kibera, Nairobi. Founded in 2018 by Adriano Situma and Daniel Ogweno, ADE CBO began as a response to the urgent needs of girls in the slums‚Äîespecially those missing school due to poverty and lack of basic supplies. What started as a small initiative has grown into a movement using football as a bridge to education, mentorship, and dignity. Today, we empower children and youth through sports, education, health, and community support, addressing the root causes of poverty and exclusion.

founders.name: Adriano Situma
founders.bio: Adriano is the driving force behind ADE CBO, inspiring youth and leading the organization with passion and vision.

founders.name: Daniel Ogweno
founders.bio: Daniel is a dedicated mentor, supporting girls and youth in Kibera through education, football, and community engagement.

metrics.label: playing in the National Super League
called to Kenya‚Äôs U15 & U17 national teams

visionSection.title: Our Vision
visionSection.description: We envision a global community that harnesses sports for transformative change, ensuring every child and family in informal settlements has an equitable and promising future. Our goal is to contribute to the achievement of SDG No.1 (No Poverty by 2030) by empowering girls in Kibera to access education, mentorship, and the opportunity to achieve their dreams through the power of football.

WhatweDo.title: What We Do
WhatweDo.intro: Our programs are designed to uplift and transform lives in Kibera.

sections.heading: Education Through Football
sections.description: We connect girls with schools through football talent scouting, turning athletic ability into academic opportunity.

sections.heading: Life Support
sections.description: We provide essential supplies‚Äîsanitary towels, underwear, soap, and food‚Äîplus mentorship to help girls stay in school and thrive. We guide girls through challenges such as early marriage, teenage pregnancy, and the risks of school dropout.

sections.heading: Mentorship & Guidance
sections.description: Our girls receive mentorship on self-esteem, life planning, and leadership to break cycles of early marriage and teenage pregnancy.

sections.heading: Community Initiatives
sections.description: We run health, nutrition, and environmental programs, and organize campaigns for girls‚Äô empowerment and community well-being.

ourMission.title: Our Mission
ourMission.description: We exist to uplift and support girls in Kibera by using football as a bridge to education, dignity, and opportunity. Through mentorship, essential support, and talent development, we create pathways for girls to break cycles of poverty, early marriage, and school dropout‚Äîand instead, become changemakers in their lives and their communities.

desktop.description: 3 girls on top row, 2 girls centered on bottom row with even spacing

girls.name: Talia Ndinada
girls.description: wants to help her community when she grows up and loves playing football
girls.sentenceInTheirWords: I wish to help my community when I grow up
girls.situation: Lives with only her mother in the Kibera slum and her mother can barely afford to feed her and cannot give her three meals a day

girls.name: Mitchell Atieno
girls.description: she loves English and is attending Toi Junior school in grade ten
girls.sentenceInTheirWords: I'll appreciate any support for ADE
girls.situation: Her mother can barely feed her and she sometimes gets sent home from school for lack of tuition and school fees

girls.name: Vivian Atieno
girls.description: she loves English and lives with her mother and is attending Kojongo High School form three
girls.sentenceInTheirWords: When I grow up I want to help vulnerable girls
girls.situation: she lost her father and lives with her mother and they live on less than a dollar a day and can't afford three meals a day

girls.name: Cynthia Anyaugo
girls.description: her favorite subject is math and she goes to New Hope Initiative Kibera living with her mother
girls.situation: Lost a parent; sponsorship ensures continued education.

girls.name: Cindy Adhiambo
girls.description: Loves playing football and tries to help her grandma who supports her the best she can
girls.sentenceInTheirWords: ADE CBO has helped us in so many ways
girls.situation: Lives with her grandma who can't afford to do a serious job to feed the family

reality.title: The Reality in Kibera
reality.subtitle: Without support, these girls face:
points: No path out of extreme poverty
reality.footer: Football brings them together. Your support keeps them in school, fed, and dreaming of a better future.
